column4: Are there different rooms in this channel, or is it just a big free-for-all?
Aww.
I feel like a stock market trader.
Okay, see if anyone recognizes my problem. My scroll wheel suddenly controls back/forward, and my back/forward (thumb) buttons control scrolling.
I suspect it may have happened when I installed imwheel, but I followed the directions.
Anyone?
C'mon.
Anyone want to help convert a Windows power-user?
there are button mappings in xorg.conf
I don't know if they will solve that problem.. but you can try switching them around..
I don't know what they represent either..  I just use the default buttons
oh.. wait. .hold on
Option         "Buttons" "7"
Zaxismapping is the wheel.. try changing the numbers there
one gives you a graphical prompt.. a dialog box.. the other is console only
yes, they do.. but one is console based.. the other gnome based
or at least x based
just restart gnome
yes.. ctrl+alt+backspace restarts gnome
nice
no idea.. haven't missed it
check the fstab.. it's one of the options there
I think there's a little customization in preferences, mouse.. but only size and shadow  I think
